title: 31+ Best Tech Fonts (Sci-Fi, Hi-Tech, Futuristic & Techno)
description: A list of the best free & premium hi-tech, futuristic, techno and sci-fi fonts perfect for branding, logos, books, games, magazines, posters and more.
author: Jacob Cass
byline: Meet our expert writers and contributors
excerpt: Techno and sci-fi fonts can add something unique to your work. See our list of the 28+ best tech fonts for graphic design, branding & logos.
text: The most technological and futuristic typefaces can give your projects a fresh touch of individuality. However, many choices are available online, making it challenging to select the best ones. So, we’re here to assist you in reducing your options and locating the best tech fonts for your science fiction-themed projects. Typefaces called tech fonts can be used in any of your futuristic design projects. Since there are numerous sci-fi subgenres, we’ll explain the fonts we’ve picked as we go. To assist, we cut through the noise and give you the best sci-fi and tech typefaces.  With any of the options on our list, you’ll say, “Beam me up, Scotty.” You’ll add a new level of flair, excitement, and professionalism to your work – perfect for graphic design, branding, and logo design. If you’re looking for more options, we have a list of the best thick and heavy fonts that might have the style you need. Depending on your theme and target audience, some of the best condensed fonts also make great tech fonts. 10+ Best Tech Fonts (Sci-Fi, Hi-Tech, Futuristic & Techno Fonts) – Free & Premium There are so many different options out there if you are looking to add techno or sci-fi ambiance to your latest project. While having so many options is a good thing, it can also have a downside. While there were many others we fell in love with, these are the best tech fonts, perfect for technology & sci-fi projects. Blackpast Futuristic Font Invasible Modern Typeface Hacklife- Font Style Tech Cyber- Technology Font Futuristic Technology Font LineTech Auranouva – Techno Font Galactus Nebula Futuristic Techno Space Font Netron For the complete list and exciting bonuses, scroll on!  Also see our compilations on the Best Robot Fonts, Best Futuristic Fonts, Best Digital Fonts and Best Glitch Fonts. UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets Download all the High Tech Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)! Top 31+ Free Futuristic Sci-Fi & High Tech Fonts Let’s jump in to these top tech fonts! 1. Blackpast – Futuristic Logo Font Blackpast Futuristic Logo Font. Image Credit: Envato Elements Typically, cities depicted in sci-fi hide a dark truth about civilization. Behind their skyscrapers, skyways, and nightlights, it was a dystopia all along. We selected Blackpast since it perfectly captures the sci-fi vibe. Our assertion is precisely reflected by the text’s use of strobing strokes and the missing sections. It features typical spacing and is an excellent option for giving your design a contemporary, futuristic feel. We tested it and discovered that it could be optimized for regular text and larger display settings. And it is accessible in both uppercase and lowercase characters.  That’s why if you want a perfect font for designing a futuristic logo, we highly recommend you check this out. 2. Invasible Modern Typeface Invasible Modern Typeface. Image Credit: Design Cuts Characters frequently dress in neon hues in science fiction to set them apart from the futuristic nightlife. Cyberpunk Edgerunners is a more current example of this. It’s where neon colors constantly stand out against the gloomy background. We encourage Invasible because it makes your project stand out. Using this typeface for titles, magazine headlines, and flyers is strongly advised. Additionally, you can use it for posters or even neon installations.  It works well for understated subjects like pop art, science fiction, and subdued future designs.  The font comes with more than 300 glyphs, and two different styles – inline and normal. 3. Hacklife- Font Style Tech Hacklife Font Style Tech. Image Credits: Envato Elements With a striking interplay of bold and thin lines, Hacklife – Font Style Tech makes a powerful visual statement. This font’s unique design, reminiscent of a ‘matrix’ aesthetic, sets it apart as an ideal choice for tech-themed projects.  This font exudes a futuristic feel that can elevate any tech- or computer-themed design project to the next level. What truly sets Hacklife apart is its unique design, where it expertly blends thick and very thin lines. This dynamic combination creates a visual contrast that immediately draws the eye.  We can say that Hacklife’s edgy and geometrical design is a testament to its modernity and innovation. Whether you’re crafting sleek user interfaces or dynamic website headers, this font’s geometric precision is our best recommendation for you.  4. Cyber- Technology Font Cyber- Technology Font: Image Credits: Envato Elements We were positively impressed by Cyber-Technology Font with a tech-inspired design that resembles cubes seamlessly fused to form letters.  This all-capslock typeface exudes a cutting-edge and futuristic aura, with each character meticulously constructed from modular building blocks. This unique construction imparts a sense of digital architecture and innovation to your designs, creating an unmistakable visual impact.  The angular precision and geometric symmetry of this font reflect the aesthetics of technology, making it an ideal choice to elevate your tech-related projects to a whole new level of modernity and sophistication. Whether it’s for logos, branding, or any design endeavor that demands a contemporary edge, this font embodies the essence of digital innovation with every character. 5. Futuristic Technology Font LineTech Line tech: Image Credits: Envato Elements LineTech is a sleek and modern font that exudes a linear, futuristic aesthetic. It offers three distinct versions: Bold, Regular, and Light, providing versatility in design choices. This font is tailor-made for projects within the realms of technology, Science, the web, and computers. Its clean and precise lines align perfectly with the visual language of these fields, making it a fitting choice for conveying complex information with clarity. LineTech’s square typeface and the intricate network of intersecting and connected lines within each character contribute to its distinct charm.  We can say that its unique design element adds a touch of intricacy and sophistication, setting it apart from more conventional fonts. It’s particularly well-suited for crafting impactful titles and logo monograms, where it can communicate a sense of precision and innovation. 6. Auranouva – Techno Font Auranouva Techno Font. Image Credit: Envato Elements No one has ever claimed that science fiction shouldn’t be sophisticated, and this font is a prime example. It is referred to as a hi-fi techno typeface inspired by futurist aesthetics. We discovered that Auranouva mixes the look of handwritten types with condensed fonts. Further testing revealed that it was created with uniform spacing in mind. We selected this typeface since it is suitable for a range of applications. You may effectively compare a world dominated by machines and the humanity found in music with Auranouva. It’s ideal for techno, sci-fi projects, video games, posters, and more. Auranouva can help you get your desired futuristic atmosphere. 7. Galactus Galactus. Image Credit: Envato Elements If there’s anything that makes this font type seem familiar, it’s the original Star Trek science fiction series. In the case of Star Trek, it belongs to the category of space opera.  We tested the font and discovered its wide, modern appearance is ideal for sci-fi logos. It’s also a wonderful logo typeface for esports, automotive, and many other industries. You can design fan-made logos of your favorite sci-fi masterpieces or Star Wars references. Special Offer You’ll find that the font comes in three weights: bold, medium, and thin. Each weight comes with an italic version as well. If you’re looking for a great font for your next project or sci-fi logos, take a serious look at Galactus. 8. Nebula Nebula. Image Credit: Design Cuts Nebula is a perfect mix of modern and retro styles. This font fits the bill if your clients want a cute sci-fi-themed project. We also believe it’s eye-catching. Beyond its cute appearance, it’s fitting for projects like retro-themed sci-fi games. It also looks good in magazines and videos. It makes images look as if they’re in motion.  Nebula can be used to create cool icons and illustrations. With the right background and color scheme, the font looks just right with any retro sci-fi project. 9. Futuristic Techno Space Futuristic Techno Space. Image Credit: Envato Elements We believe that the futuristic typeface Techno Space is ideal for depicting modern technology and space-related themes. The way the letters twist and curl makes it appear that circuits are attempting to form words. This is one of our top picks since, especially with such a shiny sheen, one can only imagine spaceships and other futuristic technology. We discovered it looked fantastic on logos and movie titles. It’s great on other text styles superimposed on backdrop imagery. It complements backgrounds with an outer-space theme beautifully. You’ll notice that the material is available in uppercase and lowercase letters. Together with numerals and punctuation, the fonts come with all the fundamental glyphs you may use in your work. And Techno Space is a sans-serif font that can optimize itself in standard text and larger display settings. 10. Netron Netron. Image Credit: Design Cuts Another futuristic typeface is Netron. This font takes up little room while being creative, like circuits expanding to make letters. Netron’s design embodies the typical sci-fi trope of machines taking over a significant portion of our lives. Our knowledge of fonts leads us to believe this typeface exudes hipness. It is a highly alluring choice. Netron has specific designs for uppercase and lowercase letters, ligatures, and stylistic alternatives that cover a wide range of potential usage.  There are numerous possibilities available to mix and match with this typeface. Professional design programs like Photoshop and Inkscape are compatible with their alternative features. 11. QUINT – High Tech Font Quint. Image Credit: Envato Elements A Techno & new-age design-inspired font, QUINT is perfect for creative projects like branding, displays, marketing, headlines, and more. An all-caps typeface font, QUINT is available with normal and bold weights, plus additional outlines for both, this font can uplift the creative aspect of your designs. 12. Gries Bold Gries Bold. Image Credit: Design Cuts Gries Bold is a great choice if you’re looking for a bold typeface for your science fiction projects. We discovered that the slogan of this bold typeface interacts with the ideas of technology and athletics. It also makes us think of ancient arcade texts. When we checked the package’s contents, we discovered that it came with capital, lowercase, and several ligatures. This gives you some latitude in using and applying it to your projects. This tech font is appropriate for logo designs and branding tech projects. You can also use it for other designs that require a tech or sporty touch. Besides letters and ligatures, it includes numbers and punctuation and supports multiple languages. 13. Vortex  Vortex Technology Scifi Future Font. Image Credit: Envato Elements A unique typeface with normal spacing Vortex is available in three weights – Thin, Bold, and Black. With excellent space utilization features, the typeface gives off a trendy and creative vibe. If you’re looking for a perfect font for designing androids, hi-tech, future, virtual reality, space, army, games, then you should check out this font. 14. Brolink – High Tech Font Brolink. Image Credit: Envato Elements Perfect for logotypes, Brolink can give your artwork and designs a modern look or a sci-fi vibe. One of the most popular choices when it comes to wide bold-based fonts, if you’re planning to use this font for logos, we recommend experimenting with uppercase and lowercase as it will make your logo more readable. 15. Exarros Exarros. Image Credit: Envato Elements Part of the sans-serif font family, Exarros gets its inspiration from futuristic and geometric elements and yet manifests itself as a modern design. With normal spacing, Exarros is ideal for product designs, logotypes, watermarks, social media posts, labels, signboards, special events, sports clubs, and much more. Consisting of four font families with futuristic caps, which provides the pack with more variable options. The font comes with glyph styles along with specified designs. Exarros is compatible with Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop CC, Adobe InDesign, or CorelDraw. 16. Chipen Chipen. Image Credit: Envato Elements With its unique graphic style, Chipen is a futuristic font that can do wonders for your sci-fi creative projects. Packed with four styles – regular, expanded, regular italic, and expanded italic, Chipen is designed to have stripes in the middle, giving it a sporty look. With its round cube cut and bold designs, Chipen is well-suited for technology, modern, and sci-fi-themed art projects. The font comes with lowercase ligatures making it perfect for creating logos. This is a great font if you are covering different eras in your sci-fi artwork. 17. TINGEE  Tingee Intergalactic Font. Image Credit: Envato Elements TINGEE is a classy addition to the sans-serif family. A perfect fusion of futuristic design and slice style, TINGEE was designed to add a touch of modern vibe to creative projects. The font can optimize itself in larger display settings which makes it suitable for displays and posters. The long vertical style and normal spacing make it the perfect choice for space, modern technology, high-end article headlines, and digital-related projects. TINGEE adds a modern vibe to your projects. 18. Alfobes Alfobes. Image Credit: Envato Elements Alfobes is an excellent addition to the handcrafted typeface design varieties that were inspired by futuristic and space-like design concepts. Optimized in both normal text and larger display settings, Alfobes comes with alphabets, numerals, and punctuations, including many alternate ligatures. This normally spaced bold and modern font can provide a futuristic vibe for any of your projects. 19. PANNIC PANNIC Sans Techno Modern Urban Font. Image Credit: Envato Elements PANNIC  is a modern typeface that has been elegantly fashioned to have a bold appearance. A normally spaced font that is optimized to work at any size. Perfect for designing book covers, magazines, logos, invitations, and film posters, PANNIC finds itself a great choice for a diverse variety of uses. With this font, you can create incredible designs for your projects. 20. Futrons Futrons. Image Credit: Envato Elements With its robust and classic appearance and multilingual support, Futrons is an appropriate choice for any modern or sci-fi project. You can use it conveniently in movie posters set in space or the future. Covering the entire spectrum of uppercase letters, numbers, punctuations, and non-English characters, Futrons fits perfectly in almost every creative design. 21. Proxon  Proxon Sans Serif Modern Font. Image Credit: Envato Elements Proxon, inspired by sci-fi and technology, is best for scenario branding, marketing, and technology designs. The typeface has normal spacing and is ideal for sci-fi designs, headlines, and display design pieces as well as short-length text blocks. Developed with a modern and futuristic appeal, the structure of Proxon gives off a trendy vibe. 22. DAVINCI  DAVINCI Fonts Modern Sans. Image Credit: Envato Elements An elegant addition to the handcrafted typeface design varieties of the sans-serif family, Davinci is available in normal spacing and is a perfect fit for futuristic designs. Apart from alphabets and numerals, the font contains a wide range of punctuations. Optimized in both normal and larger display text, the Davinci font is best suited for posters, web designs, branding, illustrations, badges, and more. 23. Modern Galapagos Modern  Galapagos Font. Image Credit: Envato Elements Inspired by sci-fi and technology, the Galapagos font can add beauty, luxury, and serenity to your projects. Part of the sans-serif family, it is perfectly suited for creating fashionable and bold designs such as titles, logos, branding, posters, headlines, and display purposes. Galapagos has a modern feel that makes it stand out in any project you use it with. 24. Digitechno Digitechno Futuristic Display Font. Image Credit: Envato Elements Digitechno is a unique font inspired by modern, digital, technology, and futuristic typefaces. If you’re looking for a font to design logos, covers, posters, branding, UI, and titles, then you should check out Digitechno. The font covers a wide range of characters with options for uppercase, lowercase, numerals, punctuations, symbols, and alternatives. With its robust appearance and multilingual support, Digitechno is an appropriate choice for any digital or tech project. 25. GRVTY GRVTY. Image Credit: Design Cuts This font type may not initially seem sci-fi, but it is ideal for cyberpunk subculture. We love the handmade futuristic font GRVTY since it is distinctive. Cyberpunk characters live in a dystopian environment and the underside of a supposed utopian society. You won’t be shocked to see graffiti like this on walls, given the circumstances.  GRVTY is a fantastic option. It draws inspiration from calligraffiti, a vandalism or abstract expressionism subgenre. This typeface is a great option for branding and print materials. It’s also applicable to logos, clothes, and other things. It includes a full set of abstract uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and punctuation. 26. Rowbot Typeface Rowbot Typeface. Image Credit: Design Cuts Are you finding it difficult to find an ideal font for your sci-fi film projects? Rowbot Typeface is for you. This futuristic font is an ideal choice for sci-fi movie titles or futuristic movies, tech movies, branding, and more.  It also includes stylish alternatives and more which would need a software program that supports these features such as Adobe Illustrator CS, Adobe Indesign, and CorelDraw.  27. Atecha Sport Sci-fi Atecha Sport Sci-fi. Image Credit: Design Cuts Are you finding it difficult to find a perfect sci-fi font for your gaming and technology projects? If so, then Atecha Sport Sci-fi font is an ideal choice for all such sci-fi, sports, technology, and futuristic projects.  This font comes in two styles: regular and slant which is easy to use and suitable for logos, design posters, posts on social media, and more. In addition to uppercase and lowercase letters, it also includes alternates, ligatures, numbers, and punctuations. It also supports multiple languages.  28. Oregon Oregon. Image Credit: Envato Elements Oregon is a futuristic font. This decorative font is creative and modern in design. This font has a cool linear and geometric style. This futuristic font is attractive when used in neon projects. This font comes in .OTF and .TTF file formats. This web font provides multilingual support to its users. This font is a great choice for modern and futuristic branding projects. 29. Fenomeno Fenomeno. Image Credit: Envato Elements Fenomeno is a sans-serif futuristic font. This font comes with uppercase, and lowercase letters, numbers, and a range of punctuation marks. This font is meant to be used for posters, branding, web designs, illustrations, badges, logos, etc.  This font comes in .OTF, and .TTF file formats.  The font comes with uppercase, and lowercase letters, numbers, and punctuation marks. 30. Automata Automata Font | image credit: nos.ink Automata is a font that combines a modern appearance with easy readability, and that’s what we like about it the most! It’s smooth, packs clean lines, and sports a geometric aesthetic that seamlessly gives it a futuristic aesthetic. On top of that, we like how this pack offers a variety of customizable options such as stylistic alternates, cool discretionary ligatures, and multiple weights including Extra-Light and Black. From posters and marketing materials to branding efforts and flyers, there are plenty of projects you can maximize Automata for. 31. Discopia Discopia Font. Image Credits: Creative Market Introducing Discopia—a font inspired by futuristic and techno design trends. Perfect for gaming logos, branding, digital assets, and more. Seamlessly transition from synthwave to vaporwave aesthetics, from contemporary typographic designs to prototype concepts. With Discopia, your creations will transcend boundaries, embracing a future where creativity knows no limits. 32. Mokoto Glitch Mokoto Glitch Font. Image Credits: Creative Market Mokoto Glitch font is a groundbreaking layered multiple typeface that pushes the boundaries of design. Welcome to the future of fonts! This experimental gem creates a mesmerizing digital glitching effect, drawing inspiration from modern fonts and the captivating slicing errors found in digital systems. Mokoto is not just a typeface; it’s a journey into the unexpected, crafting something uniquely different and undeniably compelling. 33. Black Black. Image Credits: Creative Market Lastly, introducing Black—a modern, corporate sans-serif font designed with a perfect balance of minimalism and style. Ideal for branding, logos, posters, product packaging, and more. Effortlessly combine its unique alternates and two versatile weights, Regular and Bold, to create stunning variations and iconic designs. With Black, your projects will exude sophistication and versatility, setting a new standard in modern typography. ★ Bonus – Top 5 Futuristic Effect & Element Packs ★ 1. Futuristic UI Kit Futuristic UI Kit. Image Credit: Design Cuts Futuristic UI Kit, designed by Samolevsky, is a futuristic design element set with a collection of UI elements to give your projects a sci-fi appeal. With this set, you can create data displays, realistic dashboards, and UI screens arranged with lots of intricate details. With a collection of beautifully designed abstract shapes, targets, and logos; circular items like complex and simple circles, radial elements, and spheres, digital infographic charts, equalizers, data visualization elements, and much more. Whether you want to work on the futuristic user interface, motion graphics, broadcast design, sci-fi movie, high-tech brand identity, or any other design – the Futuristic UI kit is the best option and fits perfectly in almost every creative design, as it includes 200 design elements, with adequate variations to fit any project. 2. Hologlyph Action: Hologram Glitch Effect Hologlyph Action Hologram Glitch Effect. Image Credit: Design Cuts With Hologlyph Action: Hologram Glitch Effect set by Twinbrush, you can create digital glitch effects that push the borders, as well as mimic futuristic hologram and digital display effects with minimal effort and also includes specifically developed displacement and anaglyph effects. Another exciting feature of this photoshop action set is that it comes with a wide range of color options via preset output results and adjustment layers, and the results can be customized using smart filters. 3. Lunar Landscapes Kit Lunar Landscapes Kit. Image Credit: Design Cuts Drawing inspiration from the surface of the Moon, the Lunar Landscapes Kit, designed by MiksKS is ideal for creating landscapes easily in 3D software as well as creating alien planet landscapes for your sci-fi projects. It also includes 20 landscape folders, each folder containing 2 maps that draw inspiration from the surface of the Moon, using craters, rocks, and general aspects of the Moon. It also includes a series of planet surface textures that can be used in the backgrounds of 2D projects. 4. Descending – Glitch Design Elements Descending Glitch Design Elements. Image Credit: Design Cuts This set of design elements is inspired by cyberspace, glitch art, and sci-fi; and contains about 30 creative elements useful for creating amazing wallpapers, posters, and more. The Descending – Glitch Design Elements kit provides you with abstract tech circles and frames, squares, triangles, dripping borders, glitch textures/patterns, and lines. It is compatible with Adobe Illustrator CS3 or newer. EPS10 file formats can be opened with Adobe Illustrator or with newer versions, while JPEG and PNG files will work with any photo editing software. 5. Alien Planet Texture Pack Alien Planet Texture Pack. Image Credit: Design Cuts If you want to create incredible sci-fi sky and landscape effects then, Alien Planet Texture Pack is the ideal pack for you. This set comes with an immense collection of 70 outwardly ethereal rock textures. Consisting of constructed repeat patterns, which are best suited for backgrounds, web patterns, packaging, social media banners, etc. The textures included in this pack are saved as Bitmap TIF and PNG files,  small and large halftones textures, and much more. It is compatible with Adobe Illustrator Version CS5, or higher, and Adobe Photoshop CS5, or higher versions. 6. Linkspace – Futuristic Digital Police Linkspace – Futuristic Digital Police. Image Credit: Envato Elements The new Linkspace Sans Serif font is now available. It’s a futuristic typeface that’s perfect for the technology age. A lot of technical elements are included here, such as gigabytes and processors. Projects involving games, technical events, robotics, space, and aeronautics can use this font.  Our Favorite Tech Fonts Still undecided? Check out our favorite 12 tech fonts. Blackpast - Futuristic Logo Font Invasible Modern Typeface Automata Font Auranouva Techno Font Brolink Tech Font Exarros Modern Font Futuristic UI Kit Atecha Sport Sci-fi Font Gries Bold Modern Font Rowbot Tech Typeface Digitechno Tech Font Galapagos Modern Font Frequently Asked Questions What do you mean by futuristic High-Tech font? High-Tech fonts are fonts that can work for any futuristic design project. These fonts bring in the science fiction ambiance to your designs. Which High-Tech font is best in a sans-serif family? Blackpast is the futuristic logo font that belongs to the sans-serif family. Which is the High-Tech font that belongs to the style of condensed handwritten typefaces? Auranouva is inspired by futurist Aesthetics. This font belongs to the sans-serif family that follows the style of condensed handwritten typefaces. 30 Best High Tech Fonts (Free & Paid) Picking the right font for your project can have many things to consider. From the look and the feel of the font to how the font matches with others, where it will be utilized, and more. As such, it’s necessary and important that your toolbox has a broad variety of fonts and typefaces. Our list of the 30 Best Techno & Sci-Fi Fonts (Free & Paid) comes with a distinct look and feel that are suitable for just about any project that you have in mind. Space Fonts Star Wars Fonts Computer Fonts for Tech & Futuristic Designs Y2K Fonts Best Computer Fonts for Tech & Futuristic Designs
html:
The most technological and futuristic typefaces can give your projects a fresh touch of individuality. However, many choices are available online, making it challenging to select the best ones.

So, we’re here to assist you in reducing your options and locating the best tech fonts for your science fiction-themed projects.

Typefaces called tech fonts can be used in any of your futuristic design projects. Since there are numerous sci-fi subgenres, we’ll explain the fonts we’ve picked as we go.

To assist, we cut through the noise and give you the best sci-fi and tech typefaces. 

With any of the options on our list, you’ll say, “Beam me up, Scotty.” You’ll add a new level of flair, excitement, and professionalism to your work – perfect for graphic design, branding, and logo design.

If you’re looking for more options, we have a list of the best thick and heavy fonts that might have the style you need. Depending on your theme and target audience, some of the best condensed fonts also make great tech fonts.

10+ Best Tech Fonts (Sci-Fi, Hi-Tech, Futuristic & Techno Fonts) – Free & Premium

There are so many different options out there if you are looking to add techno or sci-fi ambiance to your latest project. While having so many options is a good thing, it can also have a downside. While there were many others we fell in love with, these are the best tech fonts, perfect for technology & sci-fi projects.

  1. Blackpast Futuristic Font
  2. Invasible Modern Typeface
  3. Hacklife- Font Style Tech
  4. Cyber- Technology Font
  5. Futuristic Technology Font LineTech
  6. Auranouva – Techno Font
  7. Galactus
  8. Nebula
  9. Futuristic Techno Space Font
  10. Netron

For the complete list and exciting bonuses, scroll on! 

Also see our compilations on the Best Robot Fonts, Best Futuristic Fonts, Best Digital Fonts and Best Glitch Fonts.

UNLIMITED DOWNLOADS: 50 Million+ Fonts & Design Assets

Download all the High Tech Fonts you need and many other design elements, available for a monthly subscription by subscribing to Envato Elements. The subscription costs $16.50 per month and gives you unlimited access to a massive and growing library of over 50 million items that can be downloaded as often as you need (stock effect & element packs too)!

Top 31+ Free Futuristic Sci-Fi & High Tech Fonts

Let’s jump in to these top tech fonts!

1. Blackpast – Futuristic Logo Font

Typically, cities depicted in sci-fi hide a dark truth about civilization. Behind their skyscrapers, skyways, and nightlights, it was a dystopia all along.

We selected Blackpast since it perfectly captures the sci-fi vibe. Our assertion is precisely reflected by the text’s use of strobing strokes and the missing sections.

It features typical spacing and is an excellent option for giving your design a contemporary, futuristic feel. We tested it and discovered that it could be optimized for regular text and larger display settings. And it is accessible in both uppercase and lowercase characters. 

That’s why if you want a perfect font for designing a futuristic logo, we highly recommend you check this out.

2. Invasible Modern Typeface

Characters frequently dress in neon hues in science fiction to set them apart from the futuristic nightlife.

Cyberpunk Edgerunners is a more current example of this. It’s where neon colors constantly stand out against the gloomy background.

We encourage Invasible because it makes your project stand out. Using this typeface for titles, magazine headlines, and flyers is strongly advised. Additionally, you can use it for posters or even neon installations.  It works well for understated subjects like pop art, science fiction, and subdued future designs. 

The font comes with more than 300 glyphs, and two different styles – inline and normal.

3. Hacklife- Font Style Tech

With a striking interplay of bold and thin lines, Hacklife – Font Style Tech makes a powerful visual statement. This font’s unique design, reminiscent of a ‘matrix’ aesthetic, sets it apart as an ideal choice for tech-themed projects. 

This font exudes a futuristic feel that can elevate any tech- or computer-themed design project to the next level.

What truly sets Hacklife apart is its unique design, where it expertly blends thick and very thin lines. This dynamic combination creates a visual contrast that immediately draws the eye. 

We can say that Hacklife’s edgy and geometrical design is a testament to its modernity and innovation.

Whether you’re crafting sleek user interfaces or dynamic website headers, this font’s geometric precision is our best recommendation for you. 

4. Cyber- Technology Font

We were positively impressed by Cyber-Technology Font with a tech-inspired design that resembles cubes seamlessly fused to form letters. 

This all-capslock typeface exudes a cutting-edge and futuristic aura, with each character meticulously constructed from modular building blocks. This unique construction imparts a sense of digital architecture and innovation to your designs, creating an unmistakable visual impact. 

The angular precision and geometric symmetry of this font reflect the aesthetics of technology, making it an ideal choice to elevate your tech-related projects to a whole new level of modernity and sophistication.

Whether it’s for logos, branding, or any design endeavor that demands a contemporary edge, this font embodies the essence of digital innovation with every character.

5. Futuristic Technology Font LineTech

LineTech is a sleek and modern font that exudes a linear, futuristic aesthetic. It offers three distinct versions: Bold, Regular, and Light, providing versatility in design choices.

This font is tailor-made for projects within the realms of technology, Science, the web, and computers. Its clean and precise lines align perfectly with the visual language of these fields, making it a fitting choice for conveying complex information with clarity.

LineTech’s square typeface and the intricate network of intersecting and connected lines within each character contribute to its distinct charm. 

We can say that its unique design element adds a touch of intricacy and sophistication, setting it apart from more conventional fonts. It’s particularly well-suited for crafting impactful titles and logo monograms, where it can communicate a sense of precision and innovation.

6. Auranouva – Techno Font

No one has ever claimed that science fiction shouldn’t be sophisticated, and this font is a prime example. It is referred to as a hi-fi techno typeface inspired by futurist aesthetics.

We discovered that Auranouva mixes the look of handwritten types with condensed fonts. Further testing revealed that it was created with uniform spacing in mind. We selected this typeface since it is suitable for a range of applications.

You may effectively compare a world dominated by machines and the humanity found in music with Auranouva. It’s ideal for techno, sci-fi projects, video games, posters, and more. Auranouva can help you get your desired futuristic atmosphere.

7. Galactus

If there’s anything that makes this font type seem familiar, it’s the original Star Trek science fiction series. In the case of Star Trek, it belongs to the category of space opera. 

We tested the font and discovered its wide, modern appearance is ideal for sci-fi logos. It’s also a wonderful logo typeface for esports, automotive, and many other industries. You can design fan-made logos of your favorite sci-fi masterpieces or Star Wars references.


Special Offer


You’ll find that the font comes in three weights: bold, medium, and thin. Each weight comes with an italic version as well. If you’re looking for a great font for your next project or sci-fi logos, take a serious look at Galactus.

8. Nebula

Nebula is a perfect mix of modern and retro styles. This font fits the bill if your clients want a cute sci-fi-themed project. We also believe it’s eye-catching.

Beyond its cute appearance, it’s fitting for projects like retro-themed sci-fi games. It also looks good in magazines and videos. It makes images look as if they’re in motion. 

Nebula can be used to create cool icons and illustrations. With the right background and color scheme, the font looks just right with any retro sci-fi project.

9. Futuristic Techno Space

We believe that the futuristic typeface Techno Space is ideal for depicting modern technology and space-related themes. The way the letters twist and curl makes it appear that circuits are attempting to form words.

This is one of our top picks since, especially with such a shiny sheen, one can only imagine spaceships and other futuristic technology.

We discovered it looked fantastic on logos and movie titles. It’s great on other text styles superimposed on backdrop imagery. It complements backgrounds with an outer-space theme beautifully.

You’ll notice that the material is available in uppercase and lowercase letters. Together with numerals and punctuation, the fonts come with all the fundamental glyphs you may use in your work. And Techno Space is a sans-serif font that can optimize itself in standard text and larger display settings.

10. Netron

Another futuristic typeface is Netron. This font takes up little room while being creative, like circuits expanding to make letters. Netron’s design embodies the typical sci-fi trope of machines taking over a significant portion of our lives.

Our knowledge of fonts leads us to believe this typeface exudes hipness. It is a highly alluring choice. Netron has specific designs for uppercase and lowercase letters, ligatures, and stylistic alternatives that cover a wide range of potential usage. 

There are numerous possibilities available to mix and match with this typeface. Professional design programs like Photoshop and Inkscape are compatible with their alternative features.

11. QUINT – High Tech Font

A Techno & new-age design-inspired font, QUINT is perfect for creative projects like branding, displays, marketing, headlines, and more. An all-caps typeface font, QUINT is available with normal and bold weights, plus additional outlines for both, this font can uplift the creative aspect of your designs.

12. Gries Bold

Gries Bold is a great choice if you’re looking for a bold typeface for your science fiction projects. We discovered that the slogan of this bold typeface interacts with the ideas of technology and athletics. It also makes us think of ancient arcade texts.

When we checked the package’s contents, we discovered that it came with capital, lowercase, and several ligatures. This gives you some latitude in using and applying it to your projects.

This tech font is appropriate for logo designs and branding tech projects. You can also use it for other designs that require a tech or sporty touch. Besides letters and ligatures, it includes numbers and punctuation and supports multiple languages.

13. Vortex 

A unique typeface with normal spacing Vortex is available in three weights – Thin, Bold, and Black. With excellent space utilization features, the typeface gives off a trendy and creative vibe. If you’re looking for a perfect font for designing androids, hi-tech, future, virtual reality, space, army, games, then you should check out this font.

14. Brolink – High Tech Font

Perfect for logotypes, Brolink can give your artwork and designs a modern look or a sci-fi vibe. One of the most popular choices when it comes to wide bold-based fonts, if you’re planning to use this font for logos, we recommend experimenting with uppercase and lowercase as it will make your logo more readable.

15. Exarros

Part of the sans-serif font family, Exarros gets its inspiration from futuristic and geometric elements and yet manifests itself as a modern design. With normal spacing, Exarros is ideal for product designs, logotypes, watermarks, social media posts, labels, signboards, special events, sports clubs, and much more.

Consisting of four font families with futuristic caps, which provides the pack with more variable options. The font comes with glyph styles along with specified designs. Exarros is compatible with Adobe Illustrator, Adobe Photoshop CC, Adobe InDesign, or CorelDraw.

16. Chipen

With its unique graphic style, Chipen is a futuristic font that can do wonders for your sci-fi creative projects. Packed with four styles – regular, expanded, regular italic, and expanded italic, Chipen is designed to have stripes in the middle, giving it a sporty look.

With its round cube cut and bold designs, Chipen is well-suited for technology, modern, and sci-fi-themed art projects. The font comes with lowercase ligatures making it perfect for creating logos. This is a great font if you are covering different eras in your sci-fi artwork.

17. TINGEE 

TINGEE is a classy addition to the sans-serif family. A perfect fusion of futuristic design and slice style, TINGEE was designed to add a touch of modern vibe to creative projects. The font can optimize itself in larger display settings which makes it suitable for displays and posters.

The long vertical style and normal spacing make it the perfect choice for space, modern technology, high-end article headlines, and digital-related projects. TINGEE adds a modern vibe to your projects.

18. Alfobes

Alfobes is an excellent addition to the handcrafted typeface design varieties that were inspired by futuristic and space-like design concepts.

Optimized in both normal text and larger display settings, Alfobes comes with alphabets, numerals, and punctuations, including many alternate ligatures. This normally spaced bold and modern font can provide a futuristic vibe for any of your projects.

19. PANNIC

PANNIC  is a modern typeface that has been elegantly fashioned to have a bold appearance. A normally spaced font that is optimized to work at any size. Perfect for designing book covers, magazines, logos, invitations, and film posters, PANNIC finds itself a great choice for a diverse variety of uses.

With this font, you can create incredible designs for your projects.

20. Futrons

With its robust and classic appearance and multilingual support, Futrons is an appropriate choice for any modern or sci-fi project. You can use it conveniently in movie posters set in space or the future.

Covering the entire spectrum of uppercase letters, numbers, punctuations, and non-English characters, Futrons fits perfectly in almost every creative design.

21. Proxon 

Proxon, inspired by sci-fi and technology, is best for scenario branding, marketing, and technology designs. The typeface has normal spacing and is ideal for sci-fi designs, headlines, and display design pieces as well as short-length text blocks.

Developed with a modern and futuristic appeal, the structure of Proxon gives off a trendy vibe.

22. DAVINCI 

An elegant addition to the handcrafted typeface design varieties of the sans-serif family, Davinci is available in normal spacing and is a perfect fit for futuristic designs.

Apart from alphabets and numerals, the font contains a wide range of punctuations. Optimized in both normal and larger display text, the Davinci font is best suited for posters, web designs, branding, illustrations, badges, and more.

23. Modern Galapagos

Inspired by sci-fi and technology, the Galapagos font can add beauty, luxury, and serenity to your projects. Part of the sans-serif family, it is perfectly suited for creating fashionable and bold designs such as titles, logos, branding, posters, headlines, and display purposes.

Galapagos has a modern feel that makes it stand out in any project you use it with.

24. Digitechno

Digitechno is a unique font inspired by modern, digital, technology, and futuristic typefaces. If you’re looking for a font to design logos, covers, posters, branding, UI, and titles, then you should check out Digitechno.

The font covers a wide range of characters with options for uppercase, lowercase, numerals, punctuations, symbols, and alternatives. With its robust appearance and multilingual support, Digitechno is an appropriate choice for any digital or tech project.

25. GRVTY

This font type may not initially seem sci-fi, but it is ideal for cyberpunk subculture. We love the handmade futuristic font GRVTY since it is distinctive.

Cyberpunk characters live in a dystopian environment and the underside of a supposed utopian society.

You won’t be shocked to see graffiti like this on walls, given the circumstances.  GRVTY is a fantastic option. It draws inspiration from calligraffiti, a vandalism or abstract expressionism subgenre.

This typeface is a great option for branding and print materials. It’s also applicable to logos, clothes, and other things. It includes a full set of abstract uppercase and lowercase letters, numbers, and punctuation.


26. Rowbot Typeface

Are you finding it difficult to find an ideal font for your sci-fi film projects? Rowbot Typeface is for you. This futuristic font is an ideal choice for sci-fi movie titles or futuristic movies, tech movies, branding, and more. 

It also includes stylish alternatives and more which would need a software program that supports these features such as Adobe Illustrator CS, Adobe Indesign, and CorelDraw. 

27. Atecha Sport Sci-fi

Are you finding it difficult to find a perfect sci-fi font for your gaming and technology projects? If so, then Atecha Sport Sci-fi font is an ideal choice for all such sci-fi, sports, technology, and futuristic projects. 

This font comes in two styles: regular and slant which is easy to use and suitable for logos, design posters, posts on social media, and more. In addition to uppercase and lowercase letters, it also includes alternates, ligatures, numbers, and punctuations. It also supports multiple languages. 

28. Oregon

Oregon is a futuristic font. This decorative font is creative and modern in design. This font has a cool linear and geometric style. This futuristic font is attractive when used in neon projects.

This font comes in .OTF and .TTF file formats. This web font provides multilingual support to its users. This font is a great choice for modern and futuristic branding projects.

29. Fenomeno

Fenomeno is a sans-serif futuristic font. This font comes with uppercase, and lowercase letters, numbers, and a range of punctuation marks. This font is meant to be used for posters, branding, web designs, illustrations, badges, logos, etc. 

This font comes in .OTF, and .TTF file formats. 

The font comes with uppercase, and lowercase letters, numbers, and punctuation marks.

30. Automata

Automata is a font that combines a modern appearance with easy readability, and that’s what we like about it the most! It’s smooth, packs clean lines, and sports a geometric aesthetic that seamlessly gives it a futuristic aesthetic.

On top of that, we like how this pack offers a variety of customizable options such as stylistic alternates, cool discretionary ligatures, and multiple weights including Extra-Light and Black.

From posters and marketing materials to branding efforts and flyers, there are plenty of projects you can maximize Automata for.

31. Discopia

Introducing Discopia—a font inspired by futuristic and techno design trends. Perfect for gaming logos, branding, digital assets, and more.

Seamlessly transition from synthwave to vaporwave aesthetics, from contemporary typographic designs to prototype concepts.

With Discopia, your creations will transcend boundaries, embracing a future where creativity knows no limits.

32. Mokoto Glitch

Mokoto Glitch font is a groundbreaking layered multiple typeface that pushes the boundaries of design. Welcome to the future of fonts!

This experimental gem creates a mesmerizing digital glitching effect, drawing inspiration from modern fonts and the captivating slicing errors found in digital systems.

Mokoto is not just a typeface; it’s a journey into the unexpected, crafting something uniquely different and undeniably compelling.

33. Black

Lastly, introducing Black—a modern, corporate sans-serif font designed with a perfect balance of minimalism and style. Ideal for branding, logos, posters, product packaging, and more.

Effortlessly combine its unique alternates and two versatile weights, Regular and Bold, to create stunning variations and iconic designs.

With Black, your projects will exude sophistication and versatility, setting a new standard in modern typography.

★ Bonus – Top 5 Futuristic Effect & Element Packs ★

1. Futuristic UI Kit

Futuristic UI Kit, designed by Samolevsky, is a futuristic design element set with a collection of UI elements to give your projects a sci-fi appeal. With this set, you can create data displays, realistic dashboards, and UI screens arranged with lots of intricate details.

With a collection of beautifully designed abstract shapes, targets, and logos; circular items like complex and simple circles, radial elements, and spheres, digital infographic charts, equalizers, data visualization elements, and much more.

Whether you want to work on the futuristic user interface, motion graphics, broadcast design, sci-fi movie, high-tech brand identity, or any other design – the Futuristic UI kit is the best option and fits perfectly in almost every creative design, as it includes 200 design elements, with adequate variations to fit any project.

2. Hologlyph Action: Hologram Glitch Effect

With Hologlyph Action: Hologram Glitch Effect set by Twinbrush, you can create digital glitch effects that push the borders, as well as mimic futuristic hologram and digital display effects with minimal effort and also includes specifically developed displacement and anaglyph effects.

Another exciting feature of this photoshop action set is that it comes with a wide range of color options via preset output results and adjustment layers, and the results can be customized using smart filters.

3. Lunar Landscapes Kit

Drawing inspiration from the surface of the Moon, the Lunar Landscapes Kit, designed by MiksKS is ideal for creating landscapes easily in 3D software as well as creating alien planet landscapes for your sci-fi projects.

It also includes 20 landscape folders, each folder containing 2 maps that draw inspiration from the surface of the Moon, using craters, rocks, and general aspects of the Moon.

It also includes a series of planet surface textures that can be used in the backgrounds of 2D projects.

4. Descending – Glitch Design Elements

This set of design elements is inspired by cyberspace, glitch art, and sci-fi; and contains about 30 creative elements useful for creating amazing wallpapers, posters, and more.

The Descending – Glitch Design Elements kit provides you with abstract tech circles and frames, squares, triangles, dripping borders, glitch textures/patterns, and lines.

It is compatible with Adobe Illustrator CS3 or newer. EPS10 file formats can be opened with Adobe Illustrator or with newer versions, while JPEG and PNG files will work with any photo editing software.

5. Alien Planet Texture Pack

If you want to create incredible sci-fi sky and landscape effects then, Alien Planet Texture Pack is the ideal pack for you. This set comes with an immense collection of 70 outwardly ethereal rock textures. Consisting of constructed repeat patterns, which are best suited for backgrounds, web patterns, packaging, social media banners, etc.

The textures included in this pack are saved as Bitmap TIF and PNG files,  small and large halftones textures, and much more. It is compatible with Adobe Illustrator Version CS5, or higher, and Adobe Photoshop CS5, or higher versions.

6. Linkspace – Futuristic Digital Police

The new Linkspace Sans Serif font is now available. It’s a futuristic typeface that’s perfect for the technology age. A lot of technical elements are included here, such as gigabytes and processors. Projects involving games, technical events, robotics, space, and aeronautics can use this font.

Frequently Asked Questions

What do you mean by futuristic High-Tech font?

High-Tech fonts are fonts that can work for any futuristic design project. These fonts bring in the science fiction ambiance to your designs.

Which High-Tech font is best in a sans-serif family?

Blackpast is the futuristic logo font that belongs to the sans-serif family.

Which is the High-Tech font that belongs to the style of condensed handwritten typefaces?

Auranouva is inspired by futurist Aesthetics. This font belongs to the sans-serif family that follows the style of condensed handwritten typefaces.
